item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If cats looked like frogs we'd realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That's what people remember." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Real stupidity beats artificial intelligence every time." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The whole of life is just like watching a film. Only it's as though you always get in ten minutes after the big picture has started, and no-one will tell you the plot, so you have to work it out all yourself from the clues." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "He'd been wrong, there was a light at the end of the tunnel, and it was a flamethrower." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "And what would humans be without love?" RARE, said Death." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Always be wary of any helpful item that weighs less than its operating manual." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If complete and utter chaos was lightning, then he'd be the sort to stand on a hilltop in a thunderstorm wearing wet copper armour and shouting 'All gods are bastards!" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Neil Gaiman, Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Many people, meeting Aziraphale for the first time, formed three impressions: that he was English, that he was intelligent, and that he was gayer than a treeful of monkeys on nitrous oxide." -- Neil Gaiman, Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Studies have shown that an ant can carry one hundred times its own weight, but there is no known limit to the lifting power of the average tiny eighty-year-old Spanish peasant grandmother." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Fantasy is an exercise bicycle for the mind. It might not take you anywhere, but it tones up the muscles that can. Of course, I could be wrong." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Gods prefer simple, vicious games, where you Do Not Achieve Transcendence but Go Straight To Oblivion; a key to the understanding of all religion is that a god's idea of amusement is Snakes and Ladders with greased rungs." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Ryan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I get it,' said the prisoner. 'Good Cop, Bad Cop, eh?' If you like.' said Vimes. 'But we're a bit short staffed here, so if I give you a cigarette would you mind kicking yourself in the teeth?" -- Terry Pratchett
